resources.string: You have successfully completed the first step of the test.\n\nYou can now start the second step whenever you are ready for it.
Your time for the aptitude test has finished.\n\nYou can now start the second step whenever you are ready for it.
Are you sure you want to finish your test?
Are you sure you want to finish your test?
How confident are you about your answer?

Each question presents a scenario and you are required to respond with how you feel about that particular situation.

There are 2 types of question:
Questions which require you to simple answer with how much you prefer a given situation and the other which require you to type in your response/opinion for the situation given in the question.

Answer each question honestly as this information will be used to recommend the appropriate stream to you.

Note: The questions which require you to type in your response need constant internet connection. If you are unable to connect to the internet, you can press skip those questions.

This screen shows your result for the test.

You can click on an entry in the aptitude section to see its description or click on a recommended stream to see its description as well as the jobs present in it.

The streams with a blue line are the ones which are recommended to you. The streams with yellow line are the ones for which you scored high, but not as high as the stream's requirements. You might still consider them if you think you like the jobs present in those streams.
Unable to recommend any stream based on the received responses! Please try taking the test again and answering the questions only after giving them more consideration.
All the questions in the test are optional. So, you can skip any question if you want to do so.

Each question requires you to provide the answer as well as confidence you have regarding your answer. Your confidence will affect how much affect the question will have on your final score. The more confident you are for a correct answer, the more score you will get. Similarly, the more confident you are for a wrong answer, the more negative score you will get. So, answer each question carefully.
You can mark a question so that you can later visit it before submitting the test. To switch questions, you can use the dropdown menu which displays the current question number.

The color of the questions denotes their state:
- Red is unanswered
- Yellow is marked
- Green is answered
If you do not submit your test before the time limit, it will get auto submitted as soon as the timer reaches zero.
